result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole J Cervantes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] cases #14CF176 and #14CF266 called at 2:55pm. 
Defendant Nicole J Cervantes in court, in cutsody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court and counsel clarify that the sentence in Case #14CF176 is an imposed and stayed sentence, so the Court is not proceeding to sentencing after revocation hearing in that case. 

The Court proceeds to Sentencing After Revocation in Case #14CF266 only. 
Sentencing arguments are given by counsel
Ms. Cervantes makes a statement 

On Case #14CF266-Count #2 the Court sentences Ms. Cervantes to:
--serve 4 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for work, treatment, and medical needs, consecutive to the sentence that is currently being served in Case #14CF176

On Case #14CF266-Count #3 the Court sentences Ms. Cervantes to:
--serve 2 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for work, treatment and medical needs, consecutive to Count #2

Days credit for time already served given:  0 days 
The Court orders payment of the unpaid court financial obligations. The Court grants Ms. Cervantes sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 20 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive. 
recess 3:10pm.

Case called at 11:16 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Nicole J Cervantes in court with Attorney Stephen R. Kramer. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State files amended information; Service of AMENDED information admitted; reading waived
off-record: 11:19 - 11:24 am for Court to address another matter

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
ADA Hall submits victim impact statement/restitution form

Court IMPOSES AND STAYS 6 months jail, with Huber/Work-Release and places the Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions as listed on the criminal case settlement form, which are as follows:
--No contact with Lynn Miller
--No possession of any personally identifying information that is not in her name
--To undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay costs of $243
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge
--To pay $15 subpoena fees
--To pay restitution of $0

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 12:04 pm

cases #14CF176, #14CF266 called at 9:22am. [MK]
Defendant Nicole J Cervantes in court with Attorney Stephen R. Kramer.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
---On State's Notice to Admit Statements: after a review of the bracketed statements in the Supplemental Notice, Attorney Kramer indicates there are no constitutional attacks to any statement.
---On State's Motion to Impeach with Priors:  after hearing arguments from counsel, the Court finds that Ms. Cervantes has eleven convictions for Statute 906.09 purposes. The Court verifies with Ms. Cervantes that she understands how to answer the related questions if she testifies at trial. 
--On Case #14CF176 State's Motions in Limine #1 through #8: granted without opposition from the Defense
--On Case #14CF266 State's Motions in Limine #1 through #10: granted without opposition from the Defense

As to Case #14CF176:  the Court takes under advisement the State's Motion to Adjourn the Trial, to allow time for the State to determine whether it can have a different jail staffperson testify in place of the unavailable witness, Sgt. Handrow.  The Court requires the State to notify the Court regarding whether or not it can present the necessary witness by 4:00pm on January 23rd. 
recess 9:59am. 

NEXT:  (1) deadline of 1/23/15 at 4:00pm for State to notify the Court regarding witness availability as to the #14CF176 Jury Trial dates  (2) the 1/26/15 FSSC and 1/29/15 Jury Trial remains on the Court's calendar in case #14CF176; and the 3/9/15 FSSC and 3/12/15 Jury Trial remain on the Court's calendar in Case #14CF266

Case called at 2:20 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Nicole J Cervantes in court with Attorney Stephen R. Kramer. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Ms. Cervantes waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Speedy Trial waived by Parties, upon questioning of the Court
off-record: 2:26 - 2:40 pm for scheduling
Court announces trial dates for the record - Court orders that all motions in limine/discovery including witness lists be accomplished no later than 1/9/15. Court orders that if there are any dates needed for hearing motions, they should be scheduled no later than 1/16/15. Court orders that if there any jury instructions that are no standard, that should be included in motion practice. If seeking only standard instructions, they should be prepared to be tendered to the Court and opposing party at FSSC along with list of patterned instructions.
Recess: 2:44 pm Reconvene: 2:44 pm 
Court reviews conflict review worksheet in which no conflict was found 8/11/14, Court reviews for Atty Kramer that in Its former capacity as DA there were two cases prosecuted for Ms. Cervantes while this Court was formerly DA. Did find no conflict, not reason to recuse or disqualify. 
Recess: 2:46 pm
